intro: Campylia oenotherae, commonly known as the yellow evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers that open in the evening. The plant has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it typically grows in dry, disturbed soils. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Campylia oenotherae is often found in prairies and open woodlands, where it plays a role in pollination by attracting nocturnal insects.
